body:
Partial backtrace of the failure:

```

../src/fuzzer/fuzzer.rs:106:24:106:113: warning: Unused variable crate
rt: ---

Breakpoint 1, rust_task::fail (this=0x1b008c0, nargs=4) at ../src/rt/rust_task.cpp:222
222         DLOG(sched, task, "task %s @0x%" PRIxPTR " failing", name, this);
(gdb) bt

#27 0x005cf0be in middle::trans::iter_sequence_inner::thunk1291 ()

#29 0x00049f10 in middle::trans::iter_sequence_inner ()
#30 0x0004ab8e in middle::trans::iter_sequence::iter_sequence_body ()

#35 0x000d4bff in middle::trans::trans_block ()

```

I think this has to do with transitive dependencies between crates, which I believe don't work. So in this case I think the fuzzer crate is trying to use ast::crate from the rustc crate, and the ast::crate type contains the std::option::t type. It's when trying to find the type information for option::t that things go bad.

Another test case that fails in a different way is writing "let ast::fn_ident a = option::none" from the fuzzer crate. The compiler can't figure out that ast::fn_ident can be assigned option::t.
